p: Wound infections are usually associated with normal flora, bacteria from the environment or hospital-acquired infections [ 1]. Microorganisms infect soft tissue when the skin surface is compromised in some way. Patients with lymphoedema are at high risk of wound infection because of loss of skin integrity [ 2], resulting in ingress of microorganisms. Impaired clearance of microorganisms from the infected area due to impaired lymphatic system results in recurrent infections [ 3]. Patients with secondary lymphoedema are predisposed to cellulitis [ 4].
